originalTitle: A seat at the table or on the menu? Africa grapples with the new world order
title: Africa's Big Voice in a Changing World!
content:
Hello, Amazing Kids of Africa!

"Hello, future leaders and amazing kids of Africa! I'm your friendly kid reporter, and I'm super excited to share some important news with you today. Sometimes, grown-ups talk about big changes happening far away, and it might sound a bit like a secret code. But don't worry, I'm here to make it super simple and fun to understand!" "Imagine our whole world is like a giant school playground. All the countries are like different groups of friends, and they all play together in different ways. Sometimes, a big leader, like the head teacher, decides to change some of the playground rules. And that's kind of what's happening now in our world!"

Big Changes from Far Away

"There's a very important leader called the President of the United States. The United States is a big country very far away, across the huge ocean. This president has been making some really big changes in how countries talk to each other and work together. It's like he's shaking up the way everyone plays and cooperates!" "When we say 'shaking things up,' it means that the usual ways countries help each other, or buy and sell things from each other, or even talk about keeping peace, might be changing. It's a new time, and everyone is trying to understand what these new rules or ways of playing mean for them." "This is like if your best friend suddenly wants to play a brand new game you've never heard of before. You need to learn the rules, right? Countries are doing the same thing. They are figuring out these new world games." "Did you know? The United States is one of the most powerful countries. What its leader decides can make other countries around the world think very carefully about their own plans and friendships!"

Our Beautiful Continent, Africa!

"Now, let's talk about our wonderful home, Africa! Africa is not just one country, like a single house. It's like a whole neighbourhood of houses, with 54 different countries all together! Each country has its own special people, many different languages, and amazing animals from the lion to the giraffe." "From the sunny deserts to the green rainforests and beautiful beaches, Africa is full of wonder and different ways of life! All these countries in Africa are like a very big, diverse family. We have our own ideas, our own dreams, and our own special ways of doing things." "We all want what is best for all the children and families who live here in Africa. We want everyone to be happy, safe, and have lots of opportunities to learn and grow." "So, when big changes happen in the world, like when the US president makes new plans, all the countries in Africa listen very, very carefully. They talk to each other and ask: 'What does this mean for us? Where do we stand in all these new world games and rules?'" "Did you know? Africa is the second-largest continent in the whole world! It's so big that you could fit China, India, the United States, and most of Europe inside it!"

Why Africa Needs a Strong Voice

"Think about when you are playing a game with your friends. If you don't speak up and say what you think, maybe your friends won't know what you want to play, or they might make rules that aren't fair for you. It's exactly the same for countries in our big world family." "Africa wants to have a very strong voice. We want to tell the world what we need and what we believe is important. We want excellent schools for every single child, clean drinking water for every village, and good hospitals that help everyone get well when they are sick." "We want our continent to be peaceful, strong, and full of chances for everyone to succeed. So, when the big leaders of the world are meeting and making new plans, Africa wants to be right there. We want to be part of the big conversation, not just watching from the sidelines." "We want to help decide how the world works, how countries help each other, and how we can all live together happily. We don't want to just be told what to do by others."

What Does "A Seat at the Table" Mean?

"You might hear grown-ups say that 'Africa wants a seat at the table.' This doesn't mean a chair at a real dinner table with plates of food! It's a special way of saying that Africa wants to be included in all the important discussions." "It means we want our leaders to be invited to sit with the other big, powerful countries when they talk about global problems and global solutions. We want our ideas to be heard and taken seriously." "Imagine if all your friends were deciding what game to play after school, and you weren't even asked what you thought! That wouldn't feel fair, would it? A 'seat at the table' means Africa gets to sit with the other big countries and share its wise ideas." "It means Africa gets to say: 'This is what we think is important for our people. This is how we can help the world. And this is what we need to make our continent even better for all of us and for future generations.'" "Did you know? The African Union is a special group of all 54 African countries that works together to make sure Africa has that strong voice in the world!"

We Don't Want to Be "On the Menu"!

"Sometimes, grown-ups also say 'We don't want to be on the menu.' This is also not about tasty food! It means we don't want other countries to just decide things for Africa without asking us first. We don't want to be treated like something that can be used or told what to do without our agreement." "Africa wants to make its own choices about its future. We want to grow our own delicious food, build our own amazing factories, and create our own path forward. We don't want other powerful countries to tell us how to live or what we should do with our beautiful land, our precious animals, or our valuable resources." "It's like when you want to choose your own clothes to wear, or your own storybook to read. You want to make your own decision, not have someone else decide for you, right? Africa feels the same way about its future and its independence." "Did you know? Africa has so many valuable resources, like gold, diamonds, oil, and even sunlight for clean energy! These belong to the people of Africa."

Africa's Super Strengths!

"Our continent is super strong and full of incredible things! We have brilliant, smart people who are inventing new things every day. We have beautiful, fertile land for farming, and so many valuable resources that the world needs, like different minerals and metals." "We also have a lot of young, energetic people, like you! You are the future of Africa, and you will grow up to be amazing scientists, caring doctors, inspiring teachers, talented artists, and strong leaders. Our true strength comes from our wonderful people and our rich, diverse cultures." "Africa wants to work with other countries as true and equal partners. We want to share our strengths, our wisdom, and our unique perspectives to help make the whole world a better, fairer, and more peaceful place. We want to build strong, respectful friendships with everyone, not just receive help." "Did you know? Africa has some of the fastest-growing economies in the world, which means our countries are getting stronger and making more things that help people every day!"

Our Future is Super Bright!

"So, when the world is changing and new big plans are being made, Africa is standing tall and strong. Our leaders are talking together, making sure that our continent is seen and heard by everyone." "They are working very hard to make sure Africa has that important 'seat at the table,' so our voice can be heard loud and clear. They are building a future where all of us, the children of Africa, can have a wonderful life. A future filled with peace, good health, great education, and lots of chances to learn, play, and grow." "It's a truly exciting time to be in Africa. We are learning how to be strong and smart, and how to work with others to make our amazing continent shine even brighter for everyone! Thank you for listening, amazing kids! Keep learning, keep asking questions, and remember how special our Africa is!"
summary: As big changes happen in the world, Africa is working hard to make sure its many countries have a strong voice and can make their own choices for a bright future.
whyMatters: This is important because Africa wants to make its own decisions and build a strong, peaceful future for all its children, where our continent is heard and respected by everyone.

originalTitle: Kenya's border with Somalia set to re-open after almost 15 years
title: Kenya's border with Somalia set to re-open after almost 15 years
content: Somali Islamist militant group al-Shabab has staged several attacks in Kenya, prompting the border to be closed.

originalTitle: Port city in ruins as storm rips through Madagascar and on towards Mozambique
title: Port city in ruins as storm rips through Madagascar and on towards Mozambique
content: More than half the population is affected and most infrastructure destroyed in Toamasina, Madagascar's main port.

originalTitle: South Africa’s Ramaphosa says troops will deploy to tackle crime gangs
title: Soldiers Are Coming to Help Make South Africa Safe!
content:
Hello, Super Friends!

Hello, my super friends! Welcome to our special news report from Africa! Today, we have some important news from a beautiful country called South Africa. Our big leader, President Cyril Ramaphosa, has a very important message for everyone. It's about keeping everyone safe and happy! We will talk about how some brave helpers are going to work together to make things better.

Who is President Ramaphosa?

First, let's talk about President Ramaphosa. He is like the head teacher of the whole country! He helps make sure everyone in South Africa has a good life. He works very hard to solve problems and make good rules. When he talks, everyone listens because he cares a lot about his country and all the people in it, especially children like you! President Ramaphosa has a very big job. He wants all families to be happy and safe. He thinks about how schools can be better and how everyone can get along. He truly wants South Africa to be a wonderful place for everyone to live and grow. Did you know? A President is chosen by the people to lead their country. It's a very important job, full of big decisions to help everyone!

Our Brave Helpers: Police and Soldiers

Now, let's talk about some brave helpers! We have police officers. They wear uniforms and drive special cars. Their job is to keep the peace, help people, and catch people who do bad things. They want everyone to follow the rules so our communities can be safe. Police officers are always there to help us when we need them, like if we get lost or if someone is breaking rules. Then we have soldiers. Soldiers are also very brave! They usually help protect their country from very big dangers. They train very hard and are super strong. They wear different uniforms and also want to keep everyone safe. Sometimes, they even help people when there are big floods or other problems, like building temporary shelters or bringing food. Did you know? Police officers and soldiers go through lots of special training to be strong, smart, and ready to help! They learn how to stay calm and what to do in different situations.

When People Don't Play Fair: "Gang Wars"

Sometimes, in some places, there are groups of people who don't follow the rules. They might fight each other or do things that make other people scared. We call these groups 'gangs,' and when they fight, it's like a 'gang war.' This is not a good thing because it makes neighborhoods unsafe. People can't play outside easily, and going to school might feel scary. President Ramaphosa wants to stop these 'gang wars' so that everyone can feel safe again. He wants everyone to live in peace. These fights can make a community feel very sad and worried. Children might not be able to play in the park or visit friends easily. This is why our President is taking steps to make sure these bad things stop happening. He wants laughter and joy to fill the streets again, not fear. Did you know? Sharing and playing fair is always better than fighting! When people work together and help each other, amazing and happy things happen for everyone.

More Helpers for a Big Problem

President Ramaphosa said that the problem with these groups fighting is very big in some places. The police are already working super hard, but sometimes they need extra help. So, our President decided to send the soldiers to work *with* the police. It's like when you have a very big puzzle, and you ask a friend to help you finish it. More helpers mean the big problem can be solved faster and better! He wants to send these brave helpers to places where people are scared. The soldiers will help the police to make sure that these groups stop fighting and stop doing bad things. Their job is to help bring peace back to these areas, so everyone can feel safe and happy again. They will work as a team to make a big difference for the good.

Making Our Homes Safe Again

So, what will the soldiers do? They will go to the places where the 'gang wars' are happening. They will walk around, or patrol, with the police. You will see them in their uniforms. Their job is to make sure that people who want to do bad things know that they can't anymore. When bad people see many police and soldiers, they will know it's time to stop and follow the rules. They will help to catch the people who are making trouble. They will help make sure that streets, schools, and parks are safe again. This is all to help people feel secure in their homes and outside, enjoying their communities. Their presence will show everyone that safety is coming back to their neighborhoods. Did you know? When soldiers and police work together, they are a very strong team! They learn from each other and make sure their plans are the best to keep everyone safe.

Playtime and Learning Safely!

This is really good news for kids like you! When soldiers and police make places safe, it means you can go outside and play without feeling scared. You can walk to school with a big smile, knowing you are safe. Your parents and teachers will feel happy knowing you are safe too. They won't have to worry as much, and that makes everyone feel better. Imagine playing soccer in the park with your friends, or riding your bicycle down the street, feeling totally safe and free. That's what President Ramaphosa wants for every child in South Africa. He wants every kid to have a chance to learn, play, and grow up in a peaceful home and neighborhood, filled with joy and happiness. Did you know? Every child has the right to feel safe and happy, to play, and to learn new things every day without fear!

Working Together for Good

Our President is taking these steps because he truly cares. He wants everyone in South Africa to live in peace and harmony. This is about helping communities become strong and safe places where good things can happen. It shows that our leaders are always thinking about how to make our lives better and solve big problems. It's a big plan, but with the brave police and soldiers working together, we can all hope for safer, happier communities very soon. It reminds us that even when there are problems, good people are always working to make things right. We should all try to be good helpers in our own communities too! So, remember, my friends, when you hear about soldiers helping the police, it's about making our beautiful South Africa a super safe place for everyone. Especially for you to play, learn, and grow! That's all for our news today. Stay safe and keep smiling!
summary: President Ramaphosa of South Africa is sending soldiers to help the police stop groups of people fighting, so that everyone, especially children, can be safe and happy in their communities.
whyMatters: This is important because when soldiers help the police, it means they are working together to stop bad people from fighting and making places scary. This will make streets, parks, and schools safe again, so kids can play and learn without worry.

originalTitle: US and Taiwan sign ‘pivotal’ deal to cut trade tariffs
title: USA and Taiwan: Friends Helping Friends with a Big Deal!
content:
Hello, Super Star Listeners!

It's your friendly news reporter here, bringing you exciting news from around our big, beautiful world! Today, we're going to talk about two countries that are becoming even better friends: a place called the USA and another place called Taiwan.

Imagine our world as a giant playground. We have many friends on this playground, all with different games and toys. Sometimes, these friends decide to play together in special ways, and that's what happened with the USA and Taiwan!

Who are the USA and Taiwan?

The USA is like a very big kid on one side of the world, with lots of people, big cities, and wide-open spaces. It's known for many things, like amazing music and giant farms that grow lots of food.

Taiwan is like another friend, a bit smaller, and it's an island far away across a big ocean. Islands are pieces of land surrounded by water, just like some beautiful islands you might know here in Africa! Taiwan is very good at making smart things like computers and phones.

Did you know? The USA is the third-largest country in the world by land area! Taiwan is much smaller but has many mountains and beautiful beaches.

What is a 'Deal'?

When grown-ups say they 'make a deal,' it means they make a special agreement or a promise. It's like when you and your friend agree, 'I'll share my biscuits if you share your juice!' Both friends get something good and fair from it.

Well, the USA and Taiwan have just made a very big and very important deal! It's like a promise to help each other grow stronger and happier by trading things. They want to make it easier to share what they have.

Buying and Selling Between Countries

Have you ever bought something from a shop? Maybe a sweet or a new pencil? And the shopkeeper sells it to you for some money. That's how buying and selling works! It's called 'trade.'

Countries do this too, but on a much, much bigger scale. They buy big things from each other, and they sell big things too. When countries trade, it helps everyone get what they need and want. For example, Africa sells many precious resources and beautiful crafts to countries all over the world.

Did you know? People have been trading for thousands of years! Long, long ago, people traded shells, salt, or animals for other things they needed, even before money was invented!

What are 'Tariffs'? (It's Not a Monster!)

Now, here's a word that sounds a bit tricky, but it's actually simple: 'tariffs.' A tariff is like an extra little bit of money that one country has to pay when it buys something from another country.

Imagine you want to buy a yummy snack from a friend who brought it from a far-off village. Your friend might say, 'Okay, you can have it, but you have to pay me the normal price of the snack, PLUS a tiny extra coin because I traveled so far to get it.' That tiny extra coin is like a tariff.

These extra coins (tariffs) make things a bit more expensive for the country that is buying. So, if a country buys many things, those extra coins can add up to a lot of money! It's like paying a special 'travel fee' for goods.

Did you know? Some countries use tariffs to protect their own businesses. If things from other countries are more expensive, people might buy things made right in their own country instead!

Cutting Tariffs: Making Things Cheaper and Easier!

Guess what the USA and Taiwan decided to do? They decided to 'cut' these tariffs! No, they didn't use scissors! It means they are going to make those extra coins much, much smaller, or even get rid of them for some things. They are making the 'travel fee' lower!

So, when Taiwan buys things from the USA, it won't have to pay as much extra money. This makes everything cheaper for Taiwan! And when things are cheaper, it's easier for everyone to get what they need. It's like your friend saying, 'You know what? You don't have to pay that extra coin for the snack anymore! Just pay the normal price.' Isn't that nice?

What is Taiwan Buying from the USA?

In this big deal, Taiwan has agreed to buy some really important things from the USA. Let's look at them:

Energy: Think about what powers your lights at home, helps your mom's car drive, or makes machines work. That's energy! Taiwan is buying lots of energy from the USA. This could be things like special gases or fuels that help make electricity for homes and businesses. It helps keep the lights on, cook food, and run factories!

Did you know? We get energy from many places! The sun gives us solar energy, and the wind gives us wind energy. We also get energy from underground like oil and natural gas, which can be sent through pipes or on big ships.

Aircraft: This is a fancy word for airplanes! Yes, big, beautiful planes that fly high in the sky. Taiwan is buying many airplanes from the USA. These planes can be used to carry people from one place to another very quickly, or to carry important things, like medicines or food, across the world in just a few hours.

Imagine how exciting it is to see a big plane fly overhead! These planes help connect the world and make it feel smaller.

Did you know? The very first airplane was invented by two clever brothers named Orville and Wilbur Wright in a place called Kitty Hawk, USA, a very long time ago!

Equipment: This means lots of useful machines and tools. Think of all the big machines that help build roads, or special tools that help farmers grow more food, or even clever machines that help doctors in hospitals. Taiwan is buying all sorts of important equipment that will help their country grow and make life better for its people.

These machines can help build new schools, new houses, or even help factories make new products. They are super important for a country to develop!

Did you know? Some of the most amazing equipment helps us explore space, like rockets that take people to the moon and telescopes that let us see far-off stars!

Why is This Good for Taiwan?

Taiwan needs all these important things – energy, planes, and equipment – to keep its country strong and its people happy. By buying them from the USA with lower tariffs (that's less extra money!), Taiwan saves a lot of money! This saved money can then be used for other important things, like building more hospitals, opening more schools, or helping families in need.

It means Taiwan can grow and develop faster, making life better and brighter for everyone living there.

Why is This Good for the USA?

When Taiwan buys all these things from the USA, it's also very good for the USA! The USA gets a lot of money for selling its energy, planes, and equipment. This money helps businesses in the USA grow, and it helps the people who work in those businesses get paid fair salaries.

It helps the economy of the USA, which means the country becomes stronger and can do more good things for its own people, like building new roads or supporting education.

A Very, Very Big Amount of Money!

The deal is for about $85 billion! That's a super, super big number. It's like having 85,000 million (that's 85 with nine zeros after it!) US Dollars. Imagine trying to count that! It shows just how important and big this friendship deal is.

It means a lot of energy, a lot of planes, and a lot of equipment will be moving from the USA to Taiwan! It's one of the biggest shopping lists ever!

Did you know? If you had one billion dollars and spent one dollar every second, it would take you about 31 years to spend it all! Imagine 85 billion – that's a lot of seconds!

Friendship and Cooperation Across the World

This big deal between the USA and Taiwan shows us something very important: when countries work together and help each other, amazing things can happen! Just like when you cooperate with your friends, everyone benefits and feels happier.

It's a wonderful example of how countries, even those far away across oceans, can be good neighbors and build a better world for all of us. When countries trade fairly and make agreements, it can bring peace and happiness to many people.

Did you know? The United Nations is a big group of almost all the countries in the world. Their main job is to help countries talk to each other and work together for peace and development around the globe!

News for Our African Super Stars!

Here in Africa, we also value friendship and helping each other. This story shows us that by working together, sharing our goods, and being fair, we can all make our countries stronger and our people happier. Every trade deal, big or small, helps connect our world and make it a better place for everyone, from Africa to America to Taiwan!

Keep listening for more happy news from around our amazing planet!
summary: The USA and Taiwan made a special agreement to make it cheaper for Taiwan to buy important things like energy, airplanes, and machines from the USA, which will help both countries grow stronger and become even better friends.
whyMatters: This deal is important because it shows how countries can help each other by buying and selling things more easily and cheaply. It means Taiwan gets essential items for less money, which can be used to help its people, while the USA sells many products, which helps its businesses and workers, making both countries stronger and better connected.

title: Tuchel extended England stay for 'amazing players'
content: Thomas Tuchel says he extended his contract as England manager through to Euro 2028 because of the "amazing group of players" at his disposal.
